org.odk.collect.android.geo

Interface MapConfigurator


  • public interface MapConfigurator
    For each MapFragment implementation class, there is one instance of this interface that encapsulates the details of how to configure that MapFragment and reconfigure it as settings are changed. In particular, the buildConfig() method builds a Bundle object containing configuration details, which the MapFragment.applyConfig() method should understand. Each MapConfigurator can define its own preference widgets for customizing the MapFragment, and those preferences will be inserted on the Maps preference screen. For example, the GoogleMapConfigurator can define a "Google map style" preference with choices such as Terrain or Satellite.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      android.os.Bundle buildConfig(android.content.SharedPreferences prefs)
      Packs map-related preferences into a Bundle for MapFragment.applyConfig().
      MapFragment createMapFragment(android.content.Context context)
      Creates an unconfigured map fragment (of the type configurable by this MapConfigurator).
      java.util.List<androidx.preference.Preference> createPrefs(android.content.Context context)
      Constructs any preference widgets that are specific to this map implementation.
      java.lang.String getDisplayName(java.io.File file)
      Returns a String name for a given overlay file, or null if unsupported.
      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getPrefKeys()
      Gets the set of keys for preferences that should be watched for changes.
      boolean isAvailable(android.content.Context context)
      Returns true if this MapFragment implementation is available on this device.
      void showUnavailableMessage(android.content.Context context)
      Displays a warning to the user that this MapFragment implementation is unavailable.
      boolean supportsLayer(java.io.File file)
      Returns true if map fragments obtained from this MapConfigurator are expected to be able to render the given file as an overlay.

    • Method Detail

      • isAvailable

        boolean isAvailable(android.content.Context context)
        Returns true if this MapFragment implementation is available on this device.

      • showUnavailableMessage

        void showUnavailableMessage(android.content.Context context)
        Displays a warning to the user that this MapFragment implementation is unavailable. This will be invoked when isSupported() is false or createMapFragment(context) returns null.

      • createMapFragment

        @Nullable
MapFragment createMapFragment(android.content.Context context)
        Creates an unconfigured map fragment (of the type configurable by this MapConfigurator). This method may return null to indicate that there is no suitable MapFragment implementation available.

      • createPrefs

        java.util.List<androidx.preference.Preference> createPrefs(android.content.Context context)
        Constructs any preference widgets that are specific to this map implementation.

      • getPrefKeys

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getPrefKeys()
        Gets the set of keys for preferences that should be watched for changes.

      • buildConfig

        android.os.Bundle buildConfig(android.content.SharedPreferences prefs)
        Packs map-related preferences into a Bundle for MapFragment.applyConfig().

      • supportsLayer

        boolean supportsLayer(java.io.File file)
        Returns true if map fragments obtained from this MapConfigurator are expected to be able to render the given file as an overlay. This check determines which files appear as available Reference Layers.

      • getDisplayName

        java.lang.String getDisplayName(java.io.File file)
        Returns a String name for a given overlay file, or null if unsupported.
